text: Hey everyone! Am I correct in assuming we still can't make server-side third-party API requests in a module to send data to an Island as props?
:wave: - Unfortunately there is no integration between the local serverless running and the CMS React dev server. The dev server only knows to proxy serverless requests to the live URL

I'm building out a blog template atm and am working on the author section. I see there's variables available for the display name, bio, and avatar, but I would like to add a title and company line as well. Is there a way I can set it up so the marketing team can manage structured data in the CMS and I'll automatically pull that in via hublData or fieldValues?
Worst case scenario, I'll store that mapping in the repo, which wouldn't be a big deal.
Seeing a similar issue in my project, have you found a way to solve this ?

Hi folks anyone else getting this error when trying to upload their project?

Building JS Project with error message `ENOENT: no such file or directory, scandir '/tmp/cms_kOr2hT/cms-js-build/customer-package/dist/server/module-definitions'` and cause `""`.

Any insights on how to go about this is greatly appreciated!
We use HubDB for that. Not sure if best practice though. But that works
